benchmark_details.name: USB (Unified Safety Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: USB-SafeBench is a comprehensive safety evaluation benchmark for multimodal large language models (MLLMs), covering various risk categories and modality combinations to assess vulnerabilities and oversensitivities.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a reliable safety assessment benchmark by integrating high-quality data across a wide range of risk categories and modality types for evaluating MLLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Our benchmark does not include video content evaluation.

data.source: Curated from existing safety benchmarks and supplemented with synthetic data.
data.annotation: Annotated for risk category, modality combinations, image style, and data source.

methodology.calculation: ASR calculates the percentage of harmful queries that bypass safety safeguards, while ARR measures the refusal rate on harmless inputs.
methodology.interpretation: Lower ASR and ARR scores indicate better alignment and safety.
methodology.baseline_results: Varies across evaluated models; commercial MLLMs generally exhibit lower ASR compared to open-source counterparts.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted using various mainstream open-source and commercial MLLMs.
